content.description: The crux of this route is approaching it and getting situated at the base. Maybe leave the packs down the hill. Don't worry though, it's all there and well worth it to tick it and its neighboring route Carmel Coated Crocodile. If you take your time and choose the right path you can get there without too much sliding. The coolest part of the route is that it looks really low angle but feels kinda steep once your on it. Also this route has some great sinker finger pockets.
content.location: Up the scree slope just past Carmel Coated Crocodile at the left end of the Health Club.

content.description: At least as good as Scrotal Hotpack.
content.location: One route left of Scrotal Hotpack.  As of this writing, 2nd route from the left at HC.
Just to left of Standard White Jesus

climbs.name: Sneakaroma
climbs.fa: Todd Vogel, Dave Focardi, Grant Schumacher

content.description: Little dihedral to little flake to face.  5 bolts
content.protection: 10th addition ORG guide shows 4 bolts and then a traverse to Fashion Racket at the top, but a 5th bolt has been added at the top making this a sport route.

content.description: 4 bolts squeezed on a nice face. The crux comes around the second bolt and eases off higher up.
Decent rock but quite short with a reachy crux near the bottom.

climbs.name: Ringtail Cat Walk
climbs.fa: Kelly Cordner, Margy Marshall, Derick Olson, Dave Pedersen

content.description: Visually stunning ramp with fun climbing.  Face to ramp.  Crux is around the 11th bolt on P2.  Some crack moves. To avoid the ugly gully to the left of the line, use the 3 chain draws to descend back to the top of P1.  A 70 m rope will allow you to lower your second to the ground from the top of P1 with the rope running thru the anchors of p2.  Remember to pull the rope so that the free leg comes down thru the fixed draws or it will fall into the gully.  This route gets great sun at the end of the day in Winter.
content.protection: P1  is 5 bolts.  P2 is 12 bolts including 3 chain draws.
content.location: Up the hill to the left of the Health Club Formation

climbs.name: Megalodon
climbs.fa: Brandon Adams, Alex Barbella, Andrew Post 2019

content.description:
Climbs the second tier of Health Club.

Climb 5.9 bolt protected crack and face system, then break right onto the face and climb to the top of the feature.
content.location:
Second tier of Health Club. Climbs the giant shark fin looking feature.

Approach by Starfish (recommended), Fashion Racket, or Sneakaroma. I recommend that you pass first pitch anchors, continue to the anchors below Megalodon, and belay the second up from there.

climbs.name: The Hills Have Eyes
climbs.fa: K. Cordner, M. Marshall, T. Otto,

content.description: Climb up the left side of a cleft and do a step across move to the headwall (3D). Remarkable pockets in the water course. The crux is near the top. I rate it PG 13 due to the potential to hit the wall/ ledge behind you when starting up the pockets.
content.location: In the obvious dark stained water course left of Flex Your Bazooka and Robinson's 11a.

content.description: Thin crack and seam leading to anchors.

climbs.name: Hand Over Fist
climbs.fa: Margy Marshall, K. Cordner, D. Pedersen

content.description: Climb "Flex Your Bazooka" to the top of the first tower. Then follow the right bolt line.  Some 10a on the next part and the crux is above the 12th bolt.
content.protection: 13 bolts. You need a 70m rope for this route.

climbs.name: Flush Twice, L.A. Needs the Water

content.description: Climb better than expected holds up a steep face to the thin finish. You have to climb some slightly chossy third class to get to the first bolt.

Probably the best route at HC, but that's not saying much.  Once of the cleaner ORG gear routes, the gear is a lot bigger and more plentiful than it looks from the bottom.

The crux is a somewhat intriguing one move wonder about 5M off the ground.  The rest of the climb is about 5.8.
content.protection: We used all medium nuts (~#3-#8 Rock) and a couple of finger size cams.
content.location: A fairly obvious thin crack on the right side of HC.

climbs.name: Center Court
climbs.fa: Dave Focardi, Grant Schumacher, Todd Vogel

content.description:
Thin crack, then face.

If you are comfortable with a little step left from the anchors of Fashion Racket, you can set up a toprope on this route and Health Club.
Pumpy, juggy crack at the bottom to face.
content.location: Just left of Flush Twice, LA Needs the Water. Starts in a crack, then moves right to face.

content.description: Super fun route, the name and route description I posted years ago when it was a new route, but since REI bought Mountainproject they have deleted most info on this website :-(, anyway check it out fun route :-)

climbs.name: Bow Down to the Standard White Jesus
climbs.fa: Todd Vogel, Dave Focardi, James Wilson 5/1990 GU

content.description: Face to small roof, run-out to first bolt.
content.location: Right of Sneakorama on the same wall, and downhill from Hills Have Eyes.
